Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Sun May 14 01:14:14 2017 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "Star Of Destiny"; Control Room]
Endless waves ripple off into the distance beyond this wooden ship's railings.
Thick timbers rest underfoot, creaking steadily as the craft bobs up and down.
Large white sails billow overhead, propelling the ship across the sea's surface
at a steady pace. Puffy white clouds float through the sky placidly while a
bright yellow star beats down with merciless heat. Salt spray fills the air
intermittently when the ship crashes through a wave, and the rope rigging creaks
loudly with each gust. A few gulls circle lazily overhead, although no land is
in sight. Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking
through the windows, you see that the ship is inside the riftflow.
You see a glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark
purple leather captain's chair, a shiny round deep amethyst table with a painted
tablecloth in a vivid patchwork pattern, a large oval dark purple and light
purple cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch, Kiska the humanoid
service robot, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow
and amethyst aquatic life and coral rocks, a red plastic food storage container,
a compact red refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container, an insulated
blue cooler, a small white trash bin, Daizey the humanoid service robot, and an
insulated pink cooler here.
Lily Kaise is sleeping on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.
[0m[Miriani] [Short-range Communication] Michael Calaway transmits, "Yup."[0m
The smell of salt and the sounds of the waves slowly begin to fade, until once
more nothing but a formless void surrounds the ship.

[Starship "Star Of Destiny"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is inside the riftflow.
You see a glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark
purple leather captain's chair, a shiny round deep amethyst table with a painted
tablecloth in a vivid patchwork pattern, a large oval dark purple and light
purple cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch, Kiska the humanoid
service robot, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow
and amethyst aquatic life and coral rocks, a red plastic food storage container,
a compact red refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container, an insulated
blue cooler, a small white trash bin, Daizey the humanoid service robot, and an
insulated pink cooler here.
Lily Kaise is sleeping on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 28 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average, naturally
shaped breasts with prominent rosy nipples. Her abdomen is attractive and
punctuated by a cute navel. Her face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose
and understated chin. Her lips are lovely and blush pink and occasionally part
to reveal a set of pretty teeth. Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are
blue-green and almond-shaped. Her waist-length, straight hair is pale honey
blonde and swept up into a thick fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval
pink fingernails.
A small enameled crimson dragon pierces her belly button, a small enameled
cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe, and a small enameled cerulean
blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a pair of soft lilac satin bikini panties and a pair of white
leather clogs with a row of glittery fireflies across the toes. She is also
wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender
bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple
wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies, a
delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst crystals, a light purple
flightbag with a pastel kitten on the side, a metallic gold touch einrophone in
a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, an elegant white gold ring
inset with a perfect solitaire diamond, a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly
labeled 'Asteria', and a Tardick lizard named Asteria perched on her shoulder.
Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both shoulders, chest, back, both biceps, both
elbows, abdomen, both forearms, both wrists, both hands, waist, both hips, both
thighs, both knees, both calves, and both ankles are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

[Starship "Star Of Destiny"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is inside the riftflow.
You see a glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark
purple leather captain's chair, a shiny round deep amethyst table with a painted
tablecloth in a vivid patchwork pattern, a large oval dark purple and light

A conductor asks you for your ticket. You search your pockets, and when you
finally look up to confess you've lost it, he is gone.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.
The computer announces, "Autotravel destination reached."
The computer announces, "Autoforward beacon detected. The ship will
automatically proceed to Home Beacon Alpha 271 in thirty seconds unless aborted
or another navigation order is entered."
Via general sector communication, League Rift Accelerating Nuclear Message
Beacon transmits, "Dock at the accelerator to charge, otherwise stand by to
continue your journey."
Lily Kaise presses a button, calling up the coordinate rundown, and studies it
for a moment.

A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.

Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.

contact!

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "Star Of Destiny"; Control Room]
Endless waves ripple off into the distance beyond this wooden ship's railings.
Thick timbers rest underfoot, creaking steadily as the craft bobs up and down.
Large white sails billow overhead, propelling the ship across the sea's surface
at a steady pace. Puffy white clouds float through the sky placidly while a
bright yellow star beats down with merciless heat. Salt spray fills the air
intermittently when the ship crashes through a wave, and the rope rigging creaks
loudly with each gust. A few gulls circle lazily overhead, although no land is
in sight. Lights overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking
through the windows, you see that the ship is inside the riftflow.
You see a glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark
purple leather captain's chair, a shiny round deep amethyst table with a painted
tablecloth in a vivid patchwork pattern, a large oval dark purple and light
purple cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch, Kiska the humanoid
service robot, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow
and amethyst aquatic life and coral rocks, a compact red refrigerator, a small
white trash bin, Daizey the humanoid service robot, an insulated pink cooler,
and a Tardick lizard named Asteria here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on Shule Elemmire's lap.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.)

Notice from the Voice of the Corps: Hello, here is my report for today. First of
all, I would like to take a moment to welcome a few new cadets to the corps.
Ishtarr Tiara and Guindalen Jones, I wish you both a warm welcome and a
successful career as pilots ahead. Next, I have the state of the corps report as
of Friday May 5th for you, which goes as follows. 17 days into the current term,
the AEU had completed 10 out of 113 total completed decoy beacon drops (8.85%).
The AEU is responsible for 0 out of 10 total destroyed rats nests (0.0%), and
finally the AEU is responsible for 0 out of 0 total completed salvage
operations. That concludes the state of the corps report. Finally, I will be
headed out of communications range again shortly, but I have set up a
transmitter station 1 sector south from Campeche which will reach us out there
if you have questions, need help or just wanna chat. If any of you cadets want
to join us out there, send us a message and we will see if someone can come pick
you up. Details on the transmitter are on your message boards under
general/exploration, in response to a final op note. This concludes my report
for today, Fly safe everyone! Kim Saunders. [08:51  7 May 2317 GST]

[Starship "Star Of Destiny"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is inside the riftflow.
You see a glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark
purple leather captain's chair, a shiny round deep amethyst table with a painted
tablecloth in a vivid patchwork pattern, a large oval dark purple and light
purple cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch, Kiska the humanoid
service robot, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow
and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a compact red refrigerator, a small white
trash bin, Daizey the humanoid service robot, an insulated pink cooler, Prissy
the big violet long-haired felo, and a Tardick lizard named Asteria here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on Shule Elemmire's lap.

[Starship "Star Of Destiny"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wormhole drive tracer, a dark
purple leather captain's chair, a shiny round deep amethyst table with a painted

[Starship "Star Of Destiny"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the

has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average, naturally
shaped breasts with prominent rosy nipples. Her abdomen is attractive and
punctuated by a cute navel. More intimately, she has soft pale honey blonde
pubic hair and a girlish butt. Her face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose
and understated chin. Her lips are lovely and blush pink and occasionally part
to reveal a set of pretty teeth. Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are
blue-green and almond-shaped. Her waist-length, straight hair is pale honey
blonde and swept up into a thick fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval
pink fingernails.
A small enameled crimson dragon pierces her belly button, a small enameled
cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe, and a small enameled cerulean
blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.

across the toes. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch, and a round white rattan
coffee table with a glass top here.
You can go south and out.

Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Sun May 14 01:14:14 2017 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!
No new announcements to display.

web address.

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch, and a round white rattan
coffee table with a glass top here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.)
l

back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.

the airlock.

its claws menacingly at a plastic frond of light green sea fern.

dancing around it.

yellow eyes slowly, utterly indifferent to its surroundings.

Lily Kaise puts down a Tardick lizard named Asteria.
Lily Kaise strokes a Tardick lizard named Asteria's warm scaly skin.
A Tardick lizard named Asteria settles down, curling its limbs inward. Its eyes
close slowly and it appears to sleep.
A short amethyst soft-bodied creature with many claw-tipped tentacles wraps its
tentacles tightly around a small plastic statue of a shark, then loses interest
and jets off.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William Dove" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.

[Asteroid Belt Management Station]
This is an asteroid belt management station. Through large transparisteel
windows, you can see the asteroid stations themselves glittering amongst the
tumbling asteroids of the belt. The station managers need never actually visit
these stations, however, instead conducting their business via a number of
terminals.
The four-person mule "Liberator", the scout "Pathseeker", the vostok-class
capsule "Bolt", and the vostok-class capsule "Shooting Star" are parked here.
You see an automatic teller machine here.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch, a round white rattan
coffee table with a glass top, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a glossy silver ceramic
felo chow bowl, Purr the humanoid service robot, and a Tardick lizard named
Asteria here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The two-person light transport "Registered Merchant 408" and the five-person
pulsar "Kaboom" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine, a small trash can, and a sanitation drone
here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.

[Manhattan Spaceport; Pilot Lounge]
Seemingly wedged in the extra space between two other rooms, this lounge is very
narrow but extends far back, giving it enough room to seat quite a few people.
The light from the suspended lamps is warm and easy on the eyes, casting
everything in a rich golden glow, and the booths are padded and comfortable. The
walls are decorated with countless replicas of old flags and yellowing paper
maps of Earth's various countries. A tiny holovid nestled at the far edge of
each booth shows both a view of the landing pad outside and the latest news
broadcasts. There is a stairway at the back of the room that leads to the
garage.

[Starship "The Wolves Have Claws"; Weapons Room Three]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.

peer n
You peer north...
[Starship "The Wolves Have Claws"; Weapons Room Three]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on yellow alert. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.
Kim Saunders is standing here.
You can go north, south, and down.
peer u
You peer up...
[Starship "The Wolves Have Claws"; Weapons Room Four]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on yellow alert. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.
You can go down.

repair turet 9
Syntax:
  REPAIR <component>
  Such as: repair hull
  Or:      repair launcher 2
  Or:      repair stop
Valid components are: hull, sensors, FTL, launcher, turret, or STOP

[Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport]
Welcome to Manhattan Spaceport! The entire place seems brand new, the glass
sparkling, the plasteel gleaming. Starships arrive and depart while others sit
on individual pads, rings of lights blinking around them as they are recharged.
Occasionally, the ground vibrates and the low rumble of heavy hydraulics is
heard as a starship is brought up from the underground garage or lowered for
extended parking below. Around the huge landing pad, wide, arched doorways
framed in brushed steel lead to various station services: Repair & Rearm to the
northeast, Supply to the southeast, Station Security to the southwest, and the
Mail Room to the northwest. In addition, a classy lighted sign over one doorway
reads, 'Pilot Lounge.' You can GO into it. There is also a doorway marked
'Liaison Office' that you can also GO into. Over the corridor to the south,
another sign reads 'Spaceport Exit and Express Train.'
The two-person light corvette "League Navy Assault Corvette Kestrel-47", the
two-person light corvette "League Navy Assault Corvette Kestrel-68", and the
six-person pincer "The Wolves Have Claws" are landed here.
You see an asteroid-shaped steel trash bin here.
You can go north, northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, west, northwest,
and down.

l
[Starship "Israel Hope"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a large leather couch, and a polished
rosewood bar here.
You can go south and out.

[Residential Structure; Docking Bay]
This docking bay is relatively quiet compared to most other similar facilities.

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.

launch

ftl drydock
A lone outpost glitters in an otherwise nondescript cloud of debris.
The League's legendary shipyards hang motionless in the dark here. Once, the
stations would be all but glowing with waste heat as the Intersector
Shipbuilding Company rolled out ship after ship. Now the stations are still and
darkened, and the ISC is no more.
sit chair
You sit down on a gray leather captain's chair.
A large frame hangs in space here, sufficiently large to at least contain a
battlecruiser-class starship.
Via general sector communication, Shipyard Structure transmits in a robotic
voice, "Detecting vessel 'Praying Mantis.' Welcome to Capital Ship Drydock."

Destinations in this sector:

A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: Shipyard Structure.

use shooting
You are not currently wearing a spacesuit. Do you wish to suit up now?

y
You remove spacesuit components from a black flightbag with a red shooting star
on the side and quickly don them.
cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
The computer announces, "Beginning cycling."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow. Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.
out
You exit the ship.

[Shipyard Structure; Port Frame Assembly]

gaping wounds in the thick walls that once separated it from the assembly area
itself.  Strangely, the assembly area here seems to be mostly intact, though it
lacks the wear and tear of the rest of the structure.

l
[Starship "Praying Mantis"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a gray leather
captain's chair, and a large leather couch here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a gray leather captain's chair.)
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.

New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Praying
Mantis! Welcome to home space!"

[Starship "Praying Mantis"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are
currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in a garage.
You see a large leather chair and an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go north and south.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch, a round white rattan
coffee table with a glass top, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a glossy silver ceramic
felo chow bowl, Purr the humanoid service robot, and Xavier the old big silver
soldier felo here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at Asteroid Belt Management Station.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch, a round white rattan
coffee table with a glass top, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a glossy silver ceramic
felo chow bowl, and Purr the humanoid service robot here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.

Keyonna Bradley
She appears to be 30 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has light brown skin. Her body is full-figured with pleasantly rounded hips and
firm calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts.
Her face is heart-shaped and quite pretty, with a button nose and dimpled chin.
Her lips are pouty and pinkish red and occasionally part to reveal a set of
white teeth. Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and
squinting. Her mid-back length, thick hair is dark honey brown and in a bun. She
has long rosy fingernails. She has a small birthmark on her neck.
She seems to have a bruise on her forehead. 
 She is wearing a classic misty rose silk sheath, an exquisite gold watch with
sapphire accents, and a pair of rose pink patent leather stilettos. She is also
wearing a keychain, a message board reader, a portable newsfeed aggregator, a
small cloth sack, a small matching sequined purse, a flight control scanner, a
metachannel FTL communicator, a shimmering coral pink silk backpack, and a mood
ring. Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both biceps, both elbows, both forearms,
left wrist, both hands, both knees, both calves, and both ankles are left
uncovered.

ftl accord
[0m#SESSION 'StarConquest' ACTIVATED.[0m
A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to AFW Command (Dock One) in thirty seconds unless aborted or another
navigation order is entered."

[Accord of Free Worlds Command; Command Ring]
The corridor curves smoothly between the station's starboard and forward
horizontal supports. The bulkheads and deck are made of a darkened, glossy
metal, though not as dark as the station's exterior. Emergency lights are
mounted every three meters overhead. Dark red trim where the bulkheads meet the
deck indicate that this is the Command Deck. An interior hatch leads to the
planning room.

[Starship "Raging Seas"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a viral injection pylon launcher, a decoy beacon launcher, and a
wormhole drive tracer here.
You can go south and out.

ftl accord
A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to AFW Command (Dock One) in thirty seconds unless aborted or another
navigation order is entered."

wait.

[Starship "Raging Seas"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a viral injection pylon launcher, a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole
drive tracer, and Muffin the little orange CatBot here.
Jacob Smitt, Bryan Stout, Rogue Romano, Keyonna Bradley, and Lily Kaise are
standing here.

A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
|Us"S|BwPisPT$|`TLuO=/:|_X.w~)B[37.rq]LQ
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
Via general sector communication, AEU Solar Weather Station transmits, "Current
riftflow conditions are 2035 light-minutes per second from Galactic West."
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Raging Seas.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."

thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.

l
[Starship "Revenge"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive, a dark gray leather captain's
chair, and a decoy beacon launcher here.
You can go down and out.

--
Unique   use camera to <something>               load camera
--
Common   conceal camera                          wear camera

         remove camera                           get camera

a photo of Shule Elemmire
Shule Elemmire is in the photo. He is standing.
He appears to be at Starship "Critical Strike"; Living Quarters Block.
He appears to be 27 years old. He is about six feet and two inches tall and has
olive skin. His body is athletic with muscled hips and strong calves. He has
average-sized shoulders and a wide chest with small dark nipples. His abdomen is
flat and punctuated by a sunken navel. More intimately, he has bushy salt and
pepper pubic hair and an athletic butt. His face is average-shaped and handsome,
with a broad nose and strong chin. His lips are thin and tan and occasionally
part to reveal a set of fairly white teeth. Beneath a set of arched eyebrows,
his eyes are blue-grey and round. His shoulder-length, straight hair is blonde
and neatly trimmed over the ears and parted on the side. He has large brownish
fingernails.
 He is wearing nothing. He is also wearing a keychain, a solid silver ring
engraved with dolphins, and a gold wrist-mounted chronometer. His head, face,
both eyes, neck, both shoulders, chest, back, both biceps, both elbows, abdomen,
both forearms, both wrists, both hands, waist, both hips, groin, both thighs,
both knees, both calves, both ankles, and both feet are left uncovered.

sit
You sit down.

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Shooting Star, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
ftl chetumal
sit
You're already sitting.
The motion of the ship throws your body from side to side, but your seatbelt
holds you in place.
What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."
Via general sector communication, Chetumal transmits, "Greetings, Shooting Star!
Welcome to Chetumal Orbit!"

A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.

[Starship "Shooting Star"; Control Capsule]
This small capsule is only large enough for one person. A single flight seat
molds itself to the form of its occupant, helping to ease the burden of
acceleration along with a rather underpowered artificial gravity dampening
system. The capsule's inner workings extend into the flight cabin, with the
starship's main computer right up against the back of the seat. A rather sparse
flight control board is presented claustrophobically close to the pilot's face.
It seems to lack any sort of manual control, allowing only automatic flight
profiles to be entered into an antiquated flight computer. It does, however,
possess controls to operate a single small turret. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is at Accord of Free Worlds Command; Docking Bay Four. The hatch appears to be
locked.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go out.

[Starship "Shooting Star"; Control Capsule]
This small capsule is only large enough for one person. A single flight seat
molds itself to the form of its occupant, helping to ease the burden of
acceleration along with a rather underpowered artificial gravity dampening
system. The capsule's inner workings extend into the flight cabin, with the
starship's main computer right up against the back of the seat. A rather sparse
flight control board is presented claustrophobically close to the pilot's face.
It seems to lack any sort of manual control, allowing only automatic flight
profiles to be entered into an antiquated flight computer. It does, however,
possess controls to operate a single small turret. The status lights overhead
are currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is at Accord of Free Worlds Command; Docking Bay Four. The hatch appears to
be locked.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go out.
(You are sitting.)

I was there after all."
[General Communication] Bryan Stout transmits, "Canine incoming, clear the pad."

This small capsule is only large enough for one person. A single flight seat
molds itself to the form of its occupant, helping to ease the burden of
acceleration along with a rather underpowered artificial gravity dampening
system. The capsule's inner workings extend into the flight cabin, with the
starship's main computer right up against the back of the seat. A rather sparse
flight control board is presented claustrophobically close to the pilot's face.

profiles to be entered into an antiquated flight computer. It does, however,
possess controls to operate a single small turret. The status lights overhead
are currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is at Accord of Free Worlds Command; Docking Bay Four. The hatch appears to
be locked.

2
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
"i`8;7H'WM3f`<1a/ll(U+D\|u9BIl1_9{0Zg<f~
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
Via general sector communication, AEU Solar Weather Station transmits, "Current
riftflow conditions are 2345 light-minutes per second from Galactic West and
Very Slightly Down."
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Herding Cats.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."

ships

A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.

ftl accord
A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to AFW Command (Dock One) in thirty seconds unless aborted or another
navigation order is entered."

[Starship "Shooting Star"; Control Capsule]
This small capsule is only large enough for one person. A single flight seat
molds itself to the form of its occupant, helping to ease the burden of
acceleration along with a rather underpowered artificial gravity dampening
system. The capsule's inner workings extend into the flight cabin, with the
starship's main computer right up against the back of the seat. A rather sparse
flight control board is presented claustrophobically close to the pilot's face.
It seems to lack any sort of manual control, allowing only automatic flight
profiles to be entered into an antiquated flight computer. It does, however,
possess controls to operate a single small turret. The status lights overhead
are currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is at Accord of Free Worlds Command; Docking Bay Four. The hatch appears to
be locked.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go out.

lie bed
You lie down on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard and
filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a large
periwinkle bed pillow, a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed
pillow, and a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt on it.
wrap lily
You wrap your arms around Lily Kaise, pulling her close.

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a large oval dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a

has dark brown skin. Her body is firmly muscled with wide hips and well-muscled

navel. More intimately, she has neatly trimmed jet black pubic hair and a
muscular butt. Her face is oval and somewhat pretty, with a pointed nose and
strong chin. Her lips are full and rosy brown and occasionally part to reveal a
set of sharp teeth. Beneath a set of dark eyebrows, her eyes are dark brown and
wide. Her close-cropped, bristly hair is indigo and shaven down to stubble
except for a spikey mohawk. She has long painted metallic gold fingernails. She
has several dark red cardinal feathers hanging from a length of braided ash
brown leather in her hair. She has a past injury on her throat.

sparkling diamond stud pierces her tongue, a shiny gold ring pierces her left
nipple, a shiny gold ring pierces her right nipple, a thick gold ring with a
dolphin charm pierces her left upper ear, a thick gold ring with a spider charm
pierces her right upper ear, a small bloodstone stud with a matching spider
charm pierces her belly button, a thick gold ring pierces her right lower lip,
and a thick gold ring pierces her left lower lip.

with a small yellow and purple dichroic glass dolphin, a chunky scrap metal
necklace, a necklace with a silver charm resembling a circle of inward-facing
sharp points, a glossy obsidian wrist-mounted chronometer, a finely crafted
linked bracelet of small chainguns of blue and gold dichroic glass framed in

l
[Starship "Justen Moon"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are
currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in a garage.
You can go north and down.

l
[Starship "Justen Moon"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a wormhole drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

You can go north and down.

d
[Starship "Justen Moon"; Control Room]
You see a wormhole drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
l
[Starship "Justen Moon"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a wormhole drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
out
[Starship "Justen Moon"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, and
an early warning space defense device here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.
out
You exit the ship.

enter
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair with Xavier the old sleeping
big silver soldier felo on it, a large oval white and black cloth rug, a rare
black EAOSian contoured couch, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass
top, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red
aquatic life and coral rocks, a glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, Purr the
humanoid service robot, and Lily Kaise's workbench here.
You can go south and out.
s
[Starship "William Dove"; Base Block]
You see a soft round ocean blue rug with a design of coral and turquoise
seashells, a blueberry rattan bench with a long white and coral pink flowered
cushion on it, a round white rattan dining table with a glass top, a blueberry
rattan bench with a long white and coral pink flowered cushion on it, a rattan
floor lamp with a coral lotus shade, a blueberry rattan pantry cabinet, a small
dusky pink trash bin, an elegant purple glass vase containing a dozen red roses,
a glossy azure blue ceramic felo chow bowl, a black plastic tray of spider chow,
and Prissy the big violet long-haired felo here.
You can go north, east, south, west, up, and down.

[Starship "Justen Moon"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a wormhole drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

[0m[Miriani] (Empanda Station; Observation Center) The ten-person battlecruiser

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch, a round white rattan
coffee table with a glass top, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a glossy silver ceramic
felo chow bowl, Purr the humanoid service robot, Lily Kaise's workbench, and
Xavier the old big silver soldier felo here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.)

ABILITIES
--
MINOR REPAIR
   Slightly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REGENERATE
   Repairs a single target over time. A slow but efficient repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MINOR GROUP REPAIR
   Slightly repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 6 seconds
PREEMPTIVE REPAIR
   Disperses some minidrones for preventative repairs, which will assist other
friendly minidrones in their work.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
MODERATE REPAIR
   Repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SQUAD RESTORATION
   Grants the squad very slow generative repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MODERATE GROUP REPAIR
   Repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     60                Time To Use: 8 seconds
MAJOR REPAIR
   Greatly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
MAJOR GROUP REPAIR
   Greatly repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     80                Time To Use: 12 seconds
PULSE
   Stuns a single target.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SCRAMBLE
   Increases the likelihood that an enemy will drop intact items.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REVERB
   Damages a single target over time.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SONIC SLAM
   Interrupts a group of enemies with a large sonic burst.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SONIC WAVE
   Decreases the accuracy of a group of enemies.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     25                Time To Use: 10 seconds
SHAKE OFF
   Makes an enemy slightly more disinclined to hit you.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 4 seconds
GROUP PULSE
   Stuns a group of targets.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
CONFUSE
   Decreases the reaction time of a group of enemies.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 6 seconds
KNOCKOUT
   Makes a single target unresponsive indefinitely, or until it is hit.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 12 seconds

l
[Starship "Fearless"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a discount beacon launcher, and a
wormhole drive tracer here.
You can go up and out.

of laser resistance, a major minimodule of armor boost, a major minimodule of
explosion resistance, a major minimodule of gravitic boost, a major minimodule

The planet known as Teslaworld rotates below you, the atmosphere looking as

storms, and lightning flashes all across the sky many times a second.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.

Faraday Plaza is so named for the immense spherical Faraday cage that stretches
over its entirety, by far the largest such construct on the planet. The massive
cage encloses Teleforce Tom's Lounge and Pub as well as the Electrostatic
Exchange.

launch
Two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend from the ceiling and close around
Vernos Bailey (AEU Light Combatant). The sealed drop pod is quickly hauled into
position at the launch tube, then disappears at a high rate of speed.
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
