commands
Combat/Support
Command                                                Function
f......................................................Heavy Zapper
f2.....................................................Heavy Laser Cutter
yel....................................................Yellow Glyph       
(Projects a yellow glyph.)
red....................................................Red Glyph          
(Projects a red glyph.)
dsp....................................................Dispel Glyph       
(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
pu.....................................................Pulse              
(Stuns a single target.)
ar.....................................................Arc                
(Damages a single target.)
scr....................................................Scramble           
(Increases the likelihood that an enemy will drop intact items.)
ph.....................................................Plasma Hammer      
(Damages a single target with heavy, slow burst damage.)
wv.....................................................Wave               
(Damages a group of targets.)
er.....................................................Erode              
(Covers a group of enemies with corroding plasma, reducing their armor.)
env....................................................Envelop            
(Surrounds a target with plasma.)
cs.....................................................Cascade            
(Damages a group of targets.)
sp.....................................................Spike               (A
swift attack against a single target.)
rv.....................................................Reverb             
(Damages a single target over time.)
ss.....................................................Sonic Slam         
(Interrupts a group of enemies with a large sonic burst.)
swv....................................................Sonic Wave         
(Decreases the accuracy of a group of enemies.)
shk....................................................Shake Off          
(Makes an enemy slightly more disinclined to hit you.)
gp.....................................................Group Pulse        
(Stuns a group of targets.)
bo.....................................................Bolt               
(Heavily damages a single target.)
bur....................................................Burst              
(Heavily damages a group of targets.)
eb.....................................................Energy Bottle      
(energy bottle)
det....................................................Detonator          
(detonator)
rep....................................................Repair Drone       
(repair drone)
cover..................................................Move Into/Out of Cover
General
Command                                                Function
launch.................................................Launch To/From Mission
Area
damage.................................................View Damage
weapons................................................View Weapons/Ammo
equip/unequip..........................................Manage Modular Equipment
enter..................................................Transfer to Empty
Battlesuit/Vehicle
exit...................................................Exit Battlesuit/Vehicle
contact................................................Contact Aerial Fortress
(only possible at certain locations)

Abilities for League Infantryman
Light
   [1]  Flare                                             300,000.00
        Attracts attention from a group of enemies.
   [2]  Flash                                             950,000.00
        Startles an enemy with a bright flash of light, often causing them to
stop what they were doing.
   [3]  Illuminate                                        1,300,000.00
        Allows your squad to hit more vital parts of the enemy, increasing
damage.
   [4]  Radiate                                           2,300,000.00
        Radiates light over your battlesuit, causing the enemy to misdirect some
damage, effectively increasing armor.

        Augments your squad's accuracy.

commands
Combat/Support
Command                                                Function
yel....................................................Yellow Glyph       
(Projects a yellow glyph.)
red....................................................Red Glyph          
(Projects a red glyph.)
dsp....................................................Dispel Glyph       
(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
rep....................................................Repair Drone       
(repair drone)
eb.....................................................Energy Bottle      
(energy bottle)
cover..................................................Move Into/Out of Cover
General
Command                                                Function
launch.................................................Launch To/From Mission
Area
damage.................................................View Damage
weapons................................................View Weapons/Ammo
equip/unequip..........................................Manage Modular Equipment
enter..................................................Transfer to Empty
Battlesuit/Vehicle
exit...................................................Exit Battlesuit/Vehicle
contact................................................Contact Aerial Fortress
(only possible at certain locations)

'Hey guys

l constantine
Constantine Stone
He appears to be 22 years old. He is about six feet and one inch tall and has
fair skin. His body is of average build with narrow hips and strong calves. He
has broad shoulders and a wide chest. His face is long and boyish, with a
straight nose and cleft chin. His lips are faintly upturned and light-colored
and occasionally part to reveal a set of fairly white teeth. Beneath a set of
dark eyebrows, his eyes are grey and narrow. His ear-length, straight hair is
chestnut brown and neatly combed. He has neatly trimmed light pink fingernails.
He has a past injury on his right eyebrow.
 He is wearing a standard grey shipsuit and a pair of shiny black boots. He is
also wearing a keychain, a message board reader, a portable newsfeed aggregator,
an ice blue metachannel FTL communicator, and a small cloth sack. His head,
face, both eyes, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
He is carrying nothing.
Constantine Stone says, "Hey."

Kim Saunders says, "Right, all set."

Infantryman from storage and sets it in front of you.

launch
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.

extends a series of tunnels, which are strangely organic-looking, yet clearly
crafted from metal.

burst of thrust, then hitting the ground and immediately peeling open, revealing
Vernos Bailey (Fringe Warrior).

This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.
You see Mobile Laser-Equipped Sentry Alpha, Constantine Stone (AEU Light
Combatant), Kim Saunders (AISSF Rental Advanced Combat Armour), and Vernos
Bailey (Fringe Warrior) here.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch, a round white rattan
coffee table with a glass top, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a glossy silver ceramic
felo chow bowl, Purr the humanoid service robot, and Lily Kaise's workbench
here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.)

helpcivilian
I don't understand that.
help civilian
--
Star Conquest Help: Civilian Liaisons
--
Category: Game Systems
--
Civilian liaisons are pilots in your alliance, just like you, who have the added
ability to act as go-betweens between the pilot corps and your alliance
government. These serve for one term lasting six weeks, and then the positions
are up for nomination and voting once again.
The actual positions differ among the alliances, but they all have the same
basic four functions.
* Voice - The Voice has the power to speak directly with the alliance
government. He or she can also manage voting by the pilot corps.
* Space Defense - The person in charge of space defense is able to monitor the
alliance's sectors and send information directly to alliance ships.
* Ground Squad - The person in charge of ground-based combat can view
information about the alliance's ground readiness and monitor ground actions in
progress.
* Industrial Whip - The industrial whip is able to monitor the corps' progress
toward achieving its performance goals or winning Conquest.
Civilian Liaisons
AEU
* Voice of the Corps:                    Kim Saunders                           
  0010-16336
* Space Defense Captain:                 Ather Jammoa                           
  0010-89705
* Ground Squad Leader:                   Demarco Scott                          
  0010-23181
Fringe
* Voice of the Fleet:                    Nathaniel Owens                        
  0100-04535
* Space Defense Captain:                 Hakeem Oiadip

  0000-73097
In addition, there is a counterpart liaison within the alliance government. This
person is a government official who is in charge of issues relating to the
civilian pilot corps. Note that, as a regular civilian pilot, you should
generally not contact these people directly -- that is the job of your Voice.
But if there is a pressing need to go over the head of your Voice, or if, as
Voice, you wish to communicate privately for some reason, you may wish to write
a letter to your official government liaison directly.
Government Liaisons
AEU
* Andrew Lambeth
Fringe
* Space Commodore Tashiro Yuki
* Sector Captain Conrad Hart
League
* Tobermory Wellington
Mutuality
* Aleksei Frolov
* Cassandra of Turanova
* Other relevant station controllers
EAOS
* Professor Sonorous Griswold
Special Term Actions
Regular nominations and voting both occur automatically. However, there are
other actions that may occur during a term. These actions are not based in coded
mechanics, but rather must be roleplayed appropriately with your Voice or a
government liaison.
Non-binding resolutions: The most common special action. Non-binding
resolutions, or proposals, can be initiated by the Voice at any time using the
voting machine in your liaison office's conference room. All active pilots are
free to vote however they wish on this proposal. The Voice may then communicate
the results to the government. However, the government is not obligated to take
any action that it does not consider appropriate no matter how many pilots
support it; hence "non-binding."
Recall elections: A recall election occurs when an elected office-holder has
performed unsatisfactorily and a vote is held to determine whether to remove him
or her from office before the term has ended. Most properly, more than one pilot
should petition the Voice to initiate such a proposal before it occurs. After an
appropriate time, the proposal can be ended and the results should be
communicated to the government. If the pilots are in favor of a recall and the
government considers their reasoning valid, the office-holder in question will
be removed. Pilots may also initiate such an action against their Voice, if the
situation calls for it, by petitioning their liaison within the government.
Resignations: An office-holder may communicate to their government, either
through the Voice or directly, that they cannot complete their term and wish to
resign. Usually such a resignation will be accepted within a day or two, leaving
the position vacant. This action should not be taken lightly, and all players
should seek to complete their terms. It is a responsibility both ICly and OOCly.
Special election: A special election occurs when a position is vacant in the
middle of a term (for instance, after a resignation or a recall election) and
must be filled. The Voice should allow at least 24 hours to take nominations and
should then list all interested candidates in a single proposal. At the end of
the vote, the results must be communicated to the government and the position
will be filled. Note that this is the only valid way to fill a vacant position;
an office-holder cannot, for example, resign their position and name someone
else to fill it.
Negotiations: Voices are authorized to call meetings with representatives from
other pilot corps and negotiate for new treaties or other changes in relations.
A Voice should communicate openly with his or her government and their own pilot
corps throughout this process, and verify via voting that their actions have the
corps' approval at every step in the process. A final non-binding resolution
must occur to verify the final terms of the agreement. If the government
approves the agreement, official documents will be provided for all parties to
sign in a final meeting. Note that all treaties must be justified by good
roleplaying and must fit current plotlines; buddies in different alliances often
want to make their respective corps exchange technology and such, but unless
their alliances have a lengthy history of good relations, the governments are
unlikely to consider such an exchange. Behind the scenes, theme, current
plotlines, and game balance are all taken into consideration when players are
seeking new treaties.
Declaration of war: A corps may unilaterally declare war against another pilot
corps. While this does not usually pit the alliances themselves against each
other, it will greatly escalate tensions. There should be a good reason to
consider such an action, or the government will be questioning the Voice rather
strenuously. Otherwise, the usual rules about non-binding resolutions apply.
In all corps actions, all pilots should be invited to gather to discuss the new
proposal. Witnesses should also be invited when the Voice determines the results
of a proposal. The date and time of any important meeting should be communicated
to the government in case the government liaison wishes to attend.
Note, finally, that all office-holders are under particular scrutiny, both by
their government and the media, and unwise remarks or actions can result in
controversy.
The Current Term
A civilian liaison term lasts for six weeks.
The current civilian term started on 17 April 2317 GST. Time remaining: 13 days,
4 hours, 17 minutes, and 39 seconds

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
You see an automatic teller machine, a small trash can, and a sanitation drone
here.

l
[Starship "Supernova"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole
drive tracer, an overstuffed black sofa, and a fuzzy stuffed bear here.
You can go south and out.

l super
the eight-person soothsayer mark two "Supernova"
You see a cruiser here.
"Supernova" is written along its hull in blocky silver letters.
The designation "AH-12b" is stamped in tiny letters near its landing struts.
This starship advertises its function with its form. It does not look
particularly flightworthy, with protruding turrets, communications equipment,
and a box-like protrusion in the rear where the reactionless drive and wormhole
drive reside. But, of course, it is not intended to fly through an atmosphere. A
small protrusion on the nose of the vessel is its main sensor relay. Only the
bottom appears smooth, and even that is marred by the extension of its landing
struts when not in flight.
The hull is clean and painted a deep green color with silver trim. Its laser
turrets are blackened and outlined in silver. The bays of its minicannon
launchers are somewhat scuffed and painted silver. Its landing struts are clean
and painted gunmetal grey.
It has a silver AEU logo forward on the starboard side, a geodesic radome, a
smooth dome, and a single large port covered by an iris-style hatch on the
forward end, and the hull has an odd sheen to it, as if covered in a thin
gossamer webbing.
Vernos Bailey strolls in from the pilot league liaison office.

l superonva
I see no "superonva" here.
l supernova
the eight-person soothsayer mark two "Supernova"
You see a cruiser here.
"Supernova" is written along its hull in blocky silver letters.
The designation "AH-12b" is stamped in tiny letters near its landing struts.
This starship advertises its function with its form. It does not look
particularly flightworthy, with protruding turrets, communications equipment,
and a box-like protrusion in the rear where the reactionless drive and wormhole
drive reside. But, of course, it is not intended to fly through an atmosphere. A
small protrusion on the nose of the vessel is its main sensor relay. Only the
bottom appears smooth, and even that is marred by the extension of its landing
struts when not in flight.
The hull is gleaming and painted a deep green color with silver trim. Its laser
turrets are sleek and dangerous-looking and outlined in silver. The bays of its
minicannon launchers are oiled to perfection and painted silver. Its landing
struts are flawless and strong and painted gunmetal grey.
It has a silver AEU logo forward on the starboard side, a geodesic radome, a
smooth dome, and a single large port covered by an iris-style hatch on the
forward end, and the hull has an odd sheen to it, as if covered in a thin
gossamer webbing.
transport supernova
The eight-person soothsayer mark two "Supernova" is loaded onto an automated
flatbed and slowly moved into a large garage.
d
[New Earth; Piper Wincott Memorial Garage]
You can go up.

l raging
the eight-person soothsayer mark two "Raging Seas"
You see a cruiser here.
"Raging Seas" is written along its hull in blocky silver letters.
The designation "AH-12b" is stamped in tiny letters near its landing struts.
This starship advertises its function with its form. It does not look
particularly flightworthy, with protruding turrets, communications equipment,
and a box-like protrusion in the rear where the reactionless drive and wormhole
drive reside. But, of course, it is not intended to fly through an atmosphere. A
small protrusion on the nose of the vessel is its main sensor relay. Only the
bottom appears smooth, and even that is marred by the extension of its landing
struts when not in flight.
The hull is clean and painted a deep green color with silver trim. Its laser
turrets are blackened and outlined in silver. The bays of its minicannon
launchers are clean and painted silver. Its landing struts are clean and painted
gunmetal grey.
It has a geodesic radome, a smooth dome, and a single large port covered by an
iris-style hatch on the forward end.

gen 1
Via general sector communication, this ship transmits a standard signal:
"Greetings."
The sensors tell you that this area is full of valuable salvage, but all you can
see of it yourself is dark smudges that block the light of the stars.
[General Communication] Evelyn Devereaux transmits, "Never heard of Brooklyn?"
The planet known as Teslaworld rotates below you, the atmosphere looking as
impenetrable as that of a gas giant. The thick clouds roil with continual
storms, and lightning flashes all across the sky many times a second.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.

[Teslatown; Faraday Plaza] (inside a battlesuit)
Faraday Plaza is so named for the immense spherical Faraday cage that stretches
over its entirety, by far the largest such construct on the planet. The massive
cage encloses Teleforce Tom's Lounge and Pub as well as the Electrostatic
Exchange.

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that

in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

[Starship "Fearless"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a discount beacon launcher, and a
wormhole drive tracer here.
You can go up and out.

read comm
You glance at your communicator's screen.
Notice from the Space Defense Captain: Greetings pilots! I am happy to have
noticed a sharp upswing in decoy beacon drops and missions. I encourage you all
to continue this upward trend. Remember, if anyone needs anything at all related
to space combat or anything else in general, feel free to send a letter to
Ather, or to call the space defense captain's office so we can set up times to
meet. Additionally, with the influx of new pilots, I am contemplating holding
refresher classes for how to deal with IFS, Outsiders, RATS, allied pirates etc.
Let me know when would be a good time for everyone and I'll try to set up the
best possible time. [20:28 15 May 2317 GST]
l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.

l
[Starship "Justen Moon"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a wormhole drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

[Starship "Justen Moon"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a wormhole drive tracer here.

[Starship "Justen Moon"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a wormhole drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

l
[Starship "Vengeance"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are
currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in a garage.
You see a large leather chair and an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go north and down.

Guindalen Jones
She appears to be 29 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is a bit thinner than average with slightly curved hips
and pleasantly curved calves. She has broad shoulders and somewhat large
breasts. Her face is oval, lightly-freckled, and unblemished, with a delicate
nose and round chin. Her lips are soft and pinkish red and occasionally part to
reveal a set of pretty teeth. Beneath a set of thin eyebrows, her eyes are
blue-green and round. Her mid-back length, soft with a slight wave hair is light
auburn and drawn back in pigtails. She has neatly trimmed pink fingernails.
 She is wearing a brown leather bomber jacket, a simple short-sleeved buttercup
yellow silk dress, and a pair of shiny black boots. She is also wearing a
keychain, a message board reader, a portable newsfeed aggregator, a small cloth
sack, a yellow canvas backpack, and a metachannel FTL communicator. Her head,
face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, both hands, both knees, both calves, and
both ankles are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

l
[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.

l lizard
a Tardick lizard named Asteria
This is one of the famed Tardick lizards. It has four legs: a thick, strong back
pair and a foreshortened front pair. It seems to go on all fours most of the
time, but it also stands up occasionally, using its front paws as somewhat
awkward hands. Its toes have short but sharp talons. Its skin is dark gray and
spotted with dark green, and parallel rows of silver-colored ridges run down its
back to the tip of its long tail. Its yellow eyes betray little in the way of
curiosity. A slim dark pink tongue flicks out every few seconds. It is wearing a
slim leather collar with a tag reading ASTERIA.
Lily Kaise squeezes you affectionately.
Lily Kaise stands up from a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
Lily Kaise glides south.
Lily Kaise glides in from the south.
Lily Kaise sits down on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
Lily Kaise dangles an orange scone in front of a Tardick lizard named Asteria.
The lizard's tongue flicks out once, then its head lunges forward, snapping up
the food in a sudden blur and immediately swallowing it whole.
l lizard
a Tardick lizard named Asteria
This is one of the famed Tardick lizards. It has four legs: a thick, strong back
pair and a foreshortened front pair. It seems to go on all fours most of the
time, but it also stands up occasionally, using its front paws as somewhat
awkward hands. Its toes have short but sharp talons. Its skin is dark gray and
spotted with dark green, and parallel rows of silver-colored ridges run down its
back to the tip of its long tail. Its yellow eyes betray little in the way of
curiosity. A slim dark pink tongue flicks out every few seconds. It is wearing a
slim leather collar with a tag reading ASTERIA. Its stomach is bulging, but it
seems content to slowly digest its large meal.

l
[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
Lily Kaise, Tamra Swenson, and Constantine Stone are standing here.
You can go out.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
There appear to be some people in the lounge.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The one-person cargo hauler "Dreamstar", the five-person gunship "Praying
Mantis", the one-person cargo hauler "Pretzel Paluza", and the one-person cargo
hauler "Stubborn Mule" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
Bryan Stout is standing here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.

Lily Kaise says, "Yeah seriously."

General Starship status:
HULL PLATING:                                     EAOS Plasma Resistant Plating
(248 damage absorption points) (modified to 110% by hull size and rated at 100%
of nominal) (Moderate resistance to minicannons)
REACTIONLESS DRIVE:                               EAOS Dual Reactionless Mk III
(Instantaneous velocity: 5714km/s, Maximum velocity: 24000 km/s, Acceleration
Rating: 25.0, Complete Deceleration in 5 seconds) (Running at 95% rated
efficiency and 0% rated maximum velocity)
MAIN SENSORS:                                     EAOS Superstring Perturbation
Sensor (Hull Lockon Rate: 25% Wormhole Drive Lockon Rate: 50% Cloak Resolution
Distance: 1 unit)
WEAPONS (Turrets):                                EAOS Crystalline Optics Laser
Mk II is operating at 15 damage per turret (105% of rated) and is operating at

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor

coffee table with a glass top, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a glossy silver ceramic
felo chow bowl, and Purr the humanoid service robot here.

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a large oval dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a
white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple
hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a large periwinkle bed pillow,
a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, and a hand-made
purple and amethyst flower quilt on it, a small oval turquoise rattan table with
a glass top, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, and a pair of white
leather clogs with a row of glittery fireflies across the toes here.
Lily Kaise is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a large
periwinkle bed pillow, a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed
pillow, and a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt on it.)

players coming to the game!

then hopefully you do not have to worry about the beard. If you hate your beard,
Beard-B-Gone is also available.

table from Old Earth, a textured plasteel floor lamp with a cream shade (casting

[0m#SESSION 'StarConquest' ACTIVATED.[0m
l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch, a round white rattan
coffee table with a glass top, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a glossy silver ceramic
felo chow bowl, and Purr the humanoid service robot here.
You can go south and out.

[Starship "Justen Moon"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The one-person cargo hauler "Dreamstar" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.

i
 You are wearing a soft red heather cotton polo, a pair of blue corduroy jeans,
and a pair of gray canvas sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of
white cotton briefs and a pair of white socks. You are also wearing a keychain,
a backpack, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a
solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a gold wrist-mounted chronometer.
You are concealing a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the side, a
metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a leather briefcase, a flight
control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a scorched
metal thigh holster, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a thick synthleather bandolier
with large pockets, a camera bag, and a black engineering tool case. Your head,
face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both wrists, and both hands
are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.
l
[Starship "Shooting Star"; Control Capsule]
This small capsule is only large enough for one person. A single flight seat
molds itself to the form of its occupant, helping to ease the burden of
acceleration along with a rather underpowered artificial gravity dampening
system. The capsule's inner workings extend into the flight cabin, with the
starship's main computer right up against the back of the seat. A rather sparse
flight control board is presented claustrophobically close to the pilot's face.
It seems to lack any sort of manual control, allowing only automatic flight
profiles to be entered into an antiquated flight computer. It does, however,
possess controls to operate a single small turret. The status lights overhead
are currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in a garage. The hatch appears to be locked.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go out.
out
You exit the capsule.

launch

ftl chetumal
The ship is already moving.
ftl chetumal
sit
You sit down.
What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."
Via general sector communication, Chetumal transmits, "Greetings, Justen Moon!
Welcome to Chetumal Orbit!"

A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Justen Moon, you are given launch
clearance under the AEU-Fringe non-aggression pact."
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Justen
Moon! Welcome to home space!"

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch, a round white rattan
coffee table with a glass top, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a glossy silver ceramic
felo chow bowl, and Purr the humanoid service robot here.
You can go south and out.

Enter your destination:
2
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: Quantum Skim
Accelerator to The Cross.
Would you like autopilot to take the starship through this quantum skim
accelerator?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
You feel the ship shudder slightly as it approaches a quantum skim accelerator.
The computer announces, "Initiating connection with The Cross's local quantum
skim accelerator network."
The computer announces, "Connection established. Communicating between quantum
skim acceleration gates now."
The computer announces, "Skim subroutine initializing in five seconds."
The computer announces, "Four."
The computer announces, "Three."
The computer announces, "Two."
The computer announces, "One."
The computer announces, "Skim subroutine initialized."
You feel the deck underneath you shudder violently, and you stumble slightly.
The shuddering finally settles down.
The computer announces, "Skim initialization complete."
l
[Starship "Praying Mantis"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a gray leather
captain's chair, and a large leather couch here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a gray leather captain's chair.)

green carpet, silvery gray walls, and a modestly sized modern steel desk with an

corners of the office. From somewhere comes soft, relaxing music that soothes

--
Kim,
Below is a copy of the letter I have just sent off to Sir Wellington concerning
this Allied Pirate issue.
During the course of the salvage op event that many pilots partook in, there was
an understanding. Mutuality pilot Pierre Louis as well as AEU pilot Eli Gray
brought us some information. We were told that the Allied Pirates would steer
clear of the area seeing as Mutuality friends were in the area.
Due to the large number of IFS and Outsiders in the area, Mister Kelsey says
that he had a group out there ready to defend. The incident that I recall is the
following: Myself, Morris Corlew and Nicolette Lawrence were salvaging. Jason
Rat, Bryan Stout, Emily Ford, Damien Goss and Shule Elemmire were aboard the
gunship. I believe it was my gunship, "The Storm Petrel." The issue is that
Mister Kelsey believes a cease fire was broken when the gunship fired upon his
area defenders. I was waiting in the neighboring sector with the op can so have
no idea who fired first or anything of that nature. I do believe that this was
the op in which they had to switch ships to, a pincer called, "The Wolves have
Claws," so that AEU pilot Kim Saunders could be added to the defense. I also
believe that most of the pilots thought the pirates would not be getting
involved in ops but did not realize they wouldn't be causing issues otherwise.
At any rate, I am inquiring as to whether or not we can find out who fired first
on behalf of the Mutuality pilots. I plan to ask the pilots aboard the ship
about this incident as well.
The other incident that I recall was during the early morning hours, I saw a
couple of pirates come into the sector. I did launch my corvette and they
promptly vacated the sector. I did not fire and was not fired upon.
Melinda Michaels

l
[Starship "Justen Moon"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a wormhole drive tracer and a rare black EAOSian contoured couch here.
You can go south, up, and out.
time
The timekeeping systems are nonfunctional until their power is restored.

Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.

[Starship "Praying Mantis"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a gray leather
captain's chair, and a large leather couch here.
You can go south and out.

[Type lines of input; use `.' to end or `@abort' to abort the command.]
To Whom It May Concern,

Below is my account of what I can recall of the events that transpired on the
evening of May 9, 2317. Just prior to 2300, a group of us pilots, conducted a
salvage operation. On this particular salvage operation, I was part of the
defence team and was aboard the five-person hammerhead "The Storm Petrel". I was
manning weapons room 3. the salvagers had already launched and Melinda Michaels
had moved to the adjacent sector west of the beacon sector, but had not dropped
the salvaging can as of yet.. Damien Goss flew this particular salvage
operation. Soon after launching, Damien called out over the PA that pirates were
present. At the same moment, the ship was put on red status and soon thereafter,
the first ship began to be tracked by the ship's target tracking array. As soon
as the ship went to red status, I scanned the sector to ascertain ship names and
classes. According to the ship's sensors, aside from our salvager's ships, there
were two five-person strike gunboats and two fighters in the sector. Due to the
fact that the ship went to red status, I presumed that we were engaging and
based on the sounds of the ship's weapons, so did the other gunners. Therefore,
we all opened fire as is our training when the ship is put on red status and a
ship is tracked. I have no idea if the pirates locked on our ship first or if we
were the aggressor. If there are any more questions regarding this incident,
please feel free to contact me. I hope this is helpful.

Best Regards,
*
*
*
*
*
[General Communication] Ali Candan transmits, "Fuck yes, 74 74 belt employee.
It's a lovely start to the day."
Shule Elemmire
*

To Whom It May Concern,
Below is my account of what I can recall of the events that transpired on the
evening of May 9, 2317. Just prior to 2300, a group of us pilots, conducted a
salvage operation. On this particular salvage operation, I was part of the
defence team and was aboard the five-person hammerhead "The Storm Petrel". I was
manning weapons room 3. the salvagers had already launched and Melinda Michaels
had moved to the adjacent sector west of the beacon sector, but had not dropped
the salvaging can as of yet.. Damien Goss flew this particular salvage
operation. Soon after launching, Damien called out over the PA that pirates were
present. At the same moment, the ship was put on red status and soon thereafter,
the first ship began to be tracked by the ship's target tracking array. As soon
as the ship went to red status, I scanned the sector to ascertain ship names and
classes. According to the ship's sensors, aside from our salvager's ships, there
were two five-person strike gunboats and two fighters in the sector. Due to the
fact that the ship went to red status, I presumed that we were engaging and
based on the sounds of the ship's weapons, so did the other gunners. Therefore,
we all opened fire as is our training when the ship is put on red status and a
ship is tracked. I have no idea if the pirates locked on our ship first or if we
were the aggressor. If there are any more questions regarding this incident,
please feel free to contact me. I hope this is helpful.
Best Regards,
Shule Elemmire

--
To Whom It May Concern,
Below is my account of what I can recall of the events that transpired on the
evening of May 9, 2317. Just prior to 2300, a group of us pilots, conducted a
salvage operation. On this particular salvage operation, I was part of the
defence team and was aboard the five-person hammerhead "The Storm Petrel". I was
manning weapons room 3. the salvagers had already launched and Melinda Michaels
had moved to the adjacent sector west of the beacon sector, but had not dropped
the salvaging can as of yet.. Damien Goss flew this particular salvage
operation. Soon after launching, Damien called out over the PA that pirates were
present. At the same moment, the ship was put on red status and soon thereafter,
the first ship began to be tracked by the ship's target tracking array. As soon
as the ship went to red status, I scanned the sector to ascertain ship names and
classes. According to the ship's sensors, aside from our salvager's ships, there
were two five-person strike gunboats and two fighters in the sector. Due to the
fact that the ship went to red status, I presumed that we were engaging and
based on the sounds of the ship's weapons, so did the other gunners. Therefore,
we all opened fire as is our training when the ship is put on red status and a
ship is tracked. I have no idea if the pirates locked on our ship first or if we
were the aggressor. If there are any more questions regarding this incident,
please feel free to contact me. I hope this is helpful.
Best Regards,
Shule Elemmire

l
[Residential Structure; ITPN Station; Main Circuit]
Like the docking bay to the south, this ITPN station appears to be wholly open
to space, an illusion enabled by the use of a huge single piece of curved
transparent plasteel. A metal viewing rail runs around the exterior of the
semicircular space. At its center, the pod platform is positioned directly below
a broad hole in the ceiling that leads up into open space. Pods arrive and
depart through the hole with clockwork precision. Passengers disembark and load
from a designated area at the top of some stone steps. Large displays hang from
the ceiling and provide status updates.
You can go south.
s
[Residential Structure; Docking Bay]
The three-person A.S.S. modular terroreroticist "Justen Moon" is landed here.
You can go north, south, up, and down.
d
[Residential Structure; Main Concourse]
You see an automatic teller machine and a sturdy transparisteel phone booth
here.
You can go north, northeast, southeast, south, northwest, and up.
n
[Residential Structure; Trading Center]
You can go south.
l
[Residential Structure; Trading Center]
The trading center seems to be one of the busiest places in the spaceport. Which
is not surprising, considering the profits that successful trading can bring in.
Avoiding the automated computer terminals used by the career traders, you decide
to approach a human trade clerk. This, incidentally, will also subject your
purchases and sales to less scrutiny.
You can go south.
s
[Residential Structure; Main Concourse]
You see an automatic teller machine and a sturdy transparisteel phone booth
here.
You can go north, northeast, southeast, south, northwest, and up.
ne
[Residential Structure; Mail Room]
You can go southwest.
l
[Residential Structure; Mail Room]
One thing the Residential Structure has in profusion, if not large crowds, is
mail. Letters and parcels overflow their racks and boxes and line the walls.
Obviously many residents here take advantage of the nearby mail room. Several
postal workers wander around, sorting mail by destination or inserting it in
tubes to be delivered to the apartments above the spaceport.
You can go southwest.

power

launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Justen Moon, you are given launch
clearance under the AEU-EAOS non-aggression pact."
ftl new
The ship is already moving.
ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Justen
Moon! Welcome to home space!"

read letter
--
Hi Shule, Here are some fish eggs. Don't put many of the light blue eggs which
are the Xenofish in at one time as they breed like guppies. The light green are
Aquapedes and the Light Purple are eels. They will take a day to a couple of
days to hatch. Enjoy! - Lily

read stationery
--
Date - February 2, 2316
From - Lily Kaise, AEU Ground Squad Leader
To - Shule Elemmire, AEU Voice of the Corps
Subject - Request to Petition for a Special Recall of Industrial Whip, Tatiana
Kruppin
Pursuant to the recent events and subsequent contraversy involving Tatiana
Kruppin and the crew of the Metal Heart Expedition along with our recent vote
that Tatiana's report be overruled describing her experiences with the Metal
Heart crew prior to being forced to evacuate the Metal Heart starship via Escape
Pod, this is to request that a special Recall Vote be presented to the AEU Pilot
Corps to remove Tatiana Kruppin's civilian liaison title of Industrial Whip and
related responsibilities. Initially, though, if you would deem it reasonable, I
would suggest that to avoid this complex formality, that Tatiana Kruppin is
given the recommendation that she should voluntarily resign from her position of
Industrial Whip.
Respectfully,
Lily Kaise, AEU Ground Squad Leader
--

[AEU | 10: Conquest Status] An AEU pilot corps liaison transmits, "We're

l
[Starship "Justen Moon"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a wormhole drive tracer and a rare black EAOSian contoured couch here.
You can go south, up, and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.)

You scramble to your feet.

weapons
WEAPONS
--
ACCELERATED HAND CANNON
   Module:     Projectile
   Ammunition: 373/374           Time To Fire: 4 seconds       
   Damage:     42 - 70           Splash Damage: none           
HEAVY CANNON
   Module:     Projectile
   Ammunition: 135/150           Time To Fire: 12 seconds      
   Damage:     149 - 248         Splash Damage: none           
ABILITIES
--
FLARE
   Attracts attention from a group of enemies.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     10                Time To Use: 4 seconds
FLASH
   Startles an enemy with a bright flash of light, often causing them to stop
what they were doing.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     10                Time To Use: 4 seconds
ILLUMINATE
   Allows your squad to hit more vital parts of the enemy, increasing damage.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
RADIATE
   Radiates light over your battlesuit, causing the enemy to misdirect some
damage, effectively increasing armor.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
LASER GUIDANCE
   Augments your squad's accuracy.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     25                Time To Use: 6 seconds
BLIND
   Blinds a single target for a period of time.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 6 seconds
DIRECTED FLARE
   Irritates and provokes a single target.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 4 seconds
DISTRACT
   Decreases the reaction time of a single enemy.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
BURN
   Damages a single target.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     60                Time To Use: 10 seconds
MINOR REPAIR
   Slightly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REGENERATE
   Repairs a single target over time. A slow but efficient repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MINOR GROUP REPAIR
   Slightly repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 6 seconds
PREEMPTIVE REPAIR
   Disperses some minidrones for preventative repairs, which will assist other
friendly minidrones in their work.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
MODERATE REPAIR
   Repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SQUAD RESTORATION
   Grants the squad very slow generative repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MODERATE GROUP REPAIR
   Repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     60                Time To Use: 8 seconds
ADVANCED RESOURCE DETECTION
   Scans for various resources.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 4 seconds
ACCELERATED RARE EARTHS EXTRACTION
   Extracts rare earths from the ground.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 6 seconds
SWIFT ARTIFACT EXTRACTION
   Extracts artifacts from the ground.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 10 seconds
INDUSTRIAL MINERAL EXTRACTION
   Extracts minerals from the ground.
   Module:     Teslaworld
   Energy:     0                 Time To Use: 3 seconds
Current Energy: 190/190

ftl tesla
The sensors tell you that this area is full of valuable salvage, but all you can
see of it yourself is dark smudges that block the light of the stars.
The planet known as Teslaworld rotates below you, the atmosphere looking as
impenetrable as that of a gas giant. The thick clouds roil with continual
storms, and lightning flashes all across the sky many times a second.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.

front. You carefully climb out.

n
You press a button on a League Templar, which splits open down the front. You
carefully climb inside.
[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.
n
You move north.

You can go north and south.

You move north.

l

[Site 131288152; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You can go down.
[General Communication] Ted Warburton transmits, "Yes I can switch, but Morris
had already said he wanted to go."

[0m#TRYING TO CONNECT 'star' TO 'moo.squidsoft.net' PORT '7771'.[0m
[0m#SESSION 'StarConquest' ACTIVATED.[0m
commands
Combat/Support
Command                                                Function
f......................................................Accelerated Hand Cannon
f2.....................................................Heavy Cannon
y......................................................Yellow Glyph       
(Projects a yellow glyph.)
red....................................................Red Glyph          
(Projects a red glyph.)
dis....................................................Dispel Glyph       
(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
fl.....................................................Flare              
(Attracts attention from a group of enemies.)
fls....................................................Flash              
(Startles an enemy with a bright flash of light, often causing them to stop what
they were doing.)
ill....................................................Illuminate         
(Allows your squad to hit more vital parts of the enemy, increasing damage.)
rad....................................................Radiate            
(Radiates light over your battlesuit, causing the enemy to misdirect some
damage, effectively increasing armor.)
lg.....................................................Laser Guidance     
(Augments your squad's accuracy.)
bl.....................................................Blind              
(Blinds a single target for a period of time.)
df.....................................................Directed Flare     
(Irritates and provokes a single target.)
ds.....................................................Distract           
(Decreases the reaction time of a single enemy.)
bn.....................................................Burn               
(Damages a single target.)
mn.....................................................Minor Repair       
(Slightly repairs a single target.)
reg....................................................Regenerate         
(Repairs a single target over time. A slow but efficient repair.)
mg.....................................................Minor Group Repair 
(Slightly repairs your entire squad.)
pre....................................................Preemptive Repair  
(Disperses some minidrones for preventative repairs, which will assist other
friendly minidrones in their work.)
mdr....................................................Moderate Repair    
(Repairs a single target.)
res....................................................Squad Restoration  
(Grants the squad very slow generative repair.)
mdg....................................................Moderate Group
Repair(Repairs your entire squad.)
de.....................................................Advanced Resource
Detection(Scans for various resources.)
rex....................................................Accelerated Rare Earths
Extraction(Extracts rare earths from the ground.)
art....................................................Swift Artifact
Extraction(Extracts artifacts from the ground.)
ext....................................................Industrial Mineral
Extraction(Extracts minerals from the ground.)
det....................................................Detonator          
(detonator)
eb.....................................................Energy Bottle      
(energy bottle)
rep....................................................Repair Drone       
(repair drone)
cover..................................................Move Into/Out of Cover
General
Command                                                Function
launch.................................................Launch To/From Mission
Area
damage.................................................View Damage
weapons................................................View Weapons/Ammo
equip/unequip..........................................Manage Modular Equipment
enter..................................................Transfer to Empty
Battlesuit/Vehicle
exit...................................................Exit Battlesuit/Vehicle
contact................................................Contact Aerial Fortress
(only possible at certain locations)

[Teslatown; North Gate] (inside a battlesuit)
A very tall, heavy metal archway stands at the exit of Teslatown, leading out
into the harsh landscape beyond, where one's environmental suit is their only
protection against frequent electromagnetic ministorms and constant scorching
heat.

ifle/canister/spinturret/lasercannon/laserdefense/massdriver/bomb/tentaclelaser/

cend

         use <something>                         drop <something>
         inventory                               mission/signup
         complete                                talk <anything>

         look <anything>
         north/south/east/west/northeast/northwest/southeast/southwest/ne/nw/se/
sw/up/down/out

         think <anything>                        nearby

[Starship "Fearless"; Control Room]

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch

clearance under the AEU-EAOS non-aggression pact."
ftl chetumal

ftl chetumal
The ship is already moving.
ftl chetumal
sit chair
What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.
You sit down on a black leather captain's chair.
The planet of Chetumal floats before you here, the richest planet among the
Fringe Worlds, although that isn't saying a lot.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Chetumal in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."
Via general sector communication, Chetumal transmits, "Greetings, Fearless!
Welcome to Chetumal Orbit!"

l angela
Angela Caesar
She appears to be 20 years old. She is about five feet and six inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is of average build with slightly curved hips and
pleasantly curved calves. She has slender shoulders and average-sized breasts.
Her face is long and girlish, with a wide nose and round chin. Her lips are
faintly downturned and pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of white
teeth. Beneath a set of plucked eyebrows, her eyes are blue and wide. Her
mid-back length, wavy hair is dark blonde and drawn back in a ponytail. She has
neatly trimmed clear fingernails.
 She is wearing a fierce pink and sapphire blue dinosaur mask with scowling eyes
and jagged white teeth, a standard grey shipsuit, and a pair of shiny black
boots. She is also wearing a keychain, a message board reader, a portable
newsfeed aggregator, a charred metachannel FTL communicator, a small cloth sack,
a plain flat einrophone in a dark gray leather phone holster, an indigo guitar
case, and a black flightbag. Her head, both eyes, both wrists, and both hands
are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.
Angela Caesar smiles.

charged.
Angela Caesar says, "Thanks."
